summary: Merete Muff Rosen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in 1977. Payroll certifications from February, October, and December of 1977 list her as a committee staff member. A collection of personnel records specifically related to Rosen includes payroll authorizations, a relationship disclosure form, a leave record, and an inquiry regarding her character and qualifications, all dating back to 1977. These documents suggest she was a staff member whose employment details were formally documented by the HSCA.
significance: Merete Muff Rosen's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll records and the existence of personnel documents indicate she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
